workDetails.title: Main Battle Screen for Idle RPG Game
workDetails.subtitle: Designing an Intuitive Fantasy Battle Screen for Idle RPG Adventures

content.text: My objective was to design a visually engaging and intuitive main battle screen for an idle RPG game that enhances player interaction, ensures accessibility for key gameplay features, and maintains a consistent theme aligned with the fantasy genre.

items.text: Casual Players: Focused on ease of use and intuitive controls for new users.
Hardcore Players: Expect detailed stats, efficient navigation, and access to advanced mechanics.

content.content: Collaborated with game designers, developers, and artists to conceptualize, prototype, and implement the final UI design.

items.text: Cluttered Information: Idle RPG games often overwhelm players with resource data, character stats, and menu options.
Navigation Complexity: Players need quick access to various features like upgrades, quests, and party management without disrupting gameplay.
Theme Integration: The interface needed to feel immersive and aligned with the game’s fantasy world.
Create a clear information hierarchy to prioritize combat-critical elements.
Design touch-friendly controls for mobile platforms while retaining usability for desktop players.
Ensure visual cohesion between the UI and the game’s fantasy aesthetic.
Provide real-time feedback for player actions and battle progress.

items: Analyzed successful idle RPG games for UI/UX design patterns.

items.text: Observed the balance between game aesthetics and practicality in interfaces.

items: Sketched layouts to test the placement of key elements:

items.text: Top Bar: Combat-critical stats (HP, player/enemy level).
Bottom Bar: Actionable elements like skills and abilities.
Side Panels: Secondary options (inventory, upgrades, shop).
Displays HP bars (player and enemy) prominently for quick monitoring.

items: Levels and progress timers are visible without distracting from the battle.

items.text: Focuses on visualizing the battle with character models and animations.

items: Highlights active quests with progress bars and actionable instructions.
Skill buttons are visually distinct with cooldown timers and ready-state feedback.
Used vibrant colors for clarity and engagement.
Background art complements the fantasy theme without overshadowing UI elements.
Clear, readable fonts with proper scaling for mobile and desktop platforms.
Custom icons designed to reflect their functions intuitively (e.g., guild, shop, upgrades).
Large, easily tappable buttons for mobile users.
Coin pickups, glowing buttons, and HP bar animations add a layer of interactivity.
Optimized layouts for seamless transitions between mobile and desktop gameplay.

content.text: Challenge 1: Managing screen clutter while retaining functionality.
highlight: Managing screen clutter while retaining functionality

content.text: Solution: Organized elements into panels and prioritized key features (e.g., quests, upgrades) based on player interaction frequency.
Challenge 2: Ensuring usability for new and experienced players.
highlight: Ensuring usability for new and experienced players

content.text: Solution: Created tooltips and added visual guides (e.g., quest progress indicators) for first-time users while maintaining quick access for experienced players.
Challenge 3: Aligning UI with the fantasy theme.
highlight: Aligning UI with the fantasy theme

content.text: Solution: Designed custom icons and backgrounds inspired by medieval and fantasy motifs.

items: I ensured the new UI has a much cleaner structure by grouping key elements like health bars, character abilities, and resource counters more effectively. This makes it easier for players to quickly grasp important information without feeling overwhelmed.
I also focused on making icons and labels more visually distinct to reduce cognitive load and improve clarity during gameplay.

In the new design, I used better color contrasts and alignment to highlight interactive elements, such as the "Boss" and "Shop" buttons. These elements are now more prominent and naturally guide the player's focus to critical actions during gameplay.

I reorganized the navigation by grouping core menus like Town, Map, Shop, and Guild in a vertical side panel. This creates a more intuitive flow, allowing players to switch between actions effortlessly.
Additionally, I positioned key in-battle interactions, such as Heroe abilities, near the bottom center of the screen for easier access during fast-paced gameplay.

I added dynamic counters and visual cues, such as flashing icons and highlighted goals, to provide players with immediate feedback. These additions enhance the player's understanding of progress and objectives in real time.
I updated the icons and backgrounds with more detailed and vibrant designs, giving the game a modern and polished aesthetic.
The ability icons were also refined to make them sharper and more easily recognizable, which helps players make faster decisions.

The old design felt crowded due to overlapping elements, so I focused on decluttering the screen by spacing out and organizing UI components more effectively. This improved the overall user experience and reduced visual noise.
I redesigned buttons and interactive elements with a rounded, vibrant style and added useful features like tooltips and counters. These updates make the interface more usable and visually appealing.
I also emphasized objectives like "Kill 80 enemies" in the quest panel, ensuring they stand out and draw immediate attention.
I applied a cohesive visual style across all elements in the UI, including consistent button shapes, typography, and color schemes. This unified the design and created a seamless player experience.
Clear Hierarchy: Players appreciated the clear hierarchy and the immersive visuals.
Smoother Navigation: Testers reported a smoother navigation experience compared to the previous iteration.

items.text: User Feedback is Key: Iterative testing helped fine-tune the interface to balance aesthetics and usability.
Clarity Over Complexity: Simplified designs are more engaging and easier to navigate, especially for mobile users.

workDetails.title: Gem Store UI for Idle RPG Game
workDetails.subtitle: Creating Engaging Interfaces to Boost Purchases and Drive Monetization

content.text: To design a gem store interface that maximizes user engagement, simplifies purchasing decisions, and promotes monetization by highlighting offers and incentivizing first-time purchases.

items: New Players: Attracted by first-purchase bonuses and clear pricing.
Experienced Players: Need a straightforward interface to quickly make purchases.
Designed the layout, visual elements, and user flow for the gem store interface.
Collaborated with monetization strategists to align the design with revenue goals.

content.content: The store needed to address these challenges:

items.text: Confusion in Pricing and Offers: Players often struggle to understand in-game currency systems and special promotions.
Engagement: Encourage players to make their first purchase by presenting value clearly.
Theme Integration: Maintain the visual identity of the game while creating a sales-focused interface.

items: Ensure clarity in gem pricing and bonuses to support decision-making.
Design a visually appealing interface that aligns with the game’s fantasy theme.
Highlight promotional offers to incentivize purchases.
Optimize the interface for both mobile and desktop players.
Confusion over gem pack values and bonus rewards.
Difficulty comparing gem packs.

content.content: Studied store interfaces from similar games to identify best practices, including:

items: Use of bold typography for prices.
Highlighting 'best value' offers with visual cues.
Created low-fidelity wireframes to test the layout.
Placement of gem packs in a grid for easy comparison.
Highlighted bonus offers near gem quantities.
Includes navigation tabs for different store categories (e.g., items, gems).
Red notification badges draw attention to special offers or new items.
Organized into a 2x3 grid to facilitate easy comparison.
Each pack includes:

items.text: Gem quantity with a bold, prominent font.
Price in in-game currency (K coins).
First-purchase bonus, highlighted with a blue ribbon for visibility.

items: Bright yellows and purples contrast to highlight gem packs.
Blue banners emphasize bonus offers without overwhelming the layout.
Bold, legible fonts for key information (gem quantities, prices).
Smaller, secondary text for additional details like bonus offers.
Gem icons are prominently displayed to visually communicate the content of each pack.

content.content: Adds perceived value with a "DOUBLE GEMS" tip and blue highlights.
The cute mascot provides tips, making the store feel welcoming and engaging.
Larger gem packs are visually emphasized to promote higher-value purchases.
Large buttons and tappable areas ensure usability on smaller screens.
Contrasting colors for key information (e.g., yellow prices on purple backgrounds).

content.text: Solution: Grouped content into clear sections with consistent formatting. Bonus offers are visually distinct but secondary to gem quantities.
Solution: Highlighted bonuses with blue banners and a “Tip” from the mascot.
Challenge 3: Retaining visual consistency with the game’s theme.
Solution: Used game-matching art styles and fantasy-inspired colors to create a cohesive design.

items.text: Purchase Rates: First-time purchase conversions increased by 25% after implementing the design.
Revenue Growth: Average transaction value grew by 15% due to the emphasis on larger gem packs.

items: Players appreciated the clear presentation of pricing and bonuses.
The mascot and tooltip were noted as fun and engaging additions.

items.text: Clarity Drives Conversion: Simplifying pricing and bonus information directly impacts user engagement.
Visual Hierarchy Matters: Proper emphasis on high-value offers encourages larger purchases.
Engagement Through Design: Adding playful elements like the mascot enhances the user experience.

items: Tabs and categories are intuitive, allowing users to quickly switch between different shop types (e.g., gear chests, gem store, etc.).
Large touch-friendly buttons and icons facilitate mobile usability.
Pricing, quantity, and bonuses are well-explained, reducing cognitive load.
Tooltips and the "info" icon provide additional explanations, making the experience beginner-friendly.
Gamification elements such as daily rewards, special bundles, and first-purchase offers encourage regular interaction.
The progress bar for daily rewards ("Days Checked In") provides a sense of accomplishment.
Highlighted "Claim" buttons and countdown timers add urgency for time-sensitive offers.
Confirmation cues for purchases or item selections could enhance user confidence further.

workDetails.title: Designing Seasonal Events Promotional Banners
workDetails.subtitle: Festive Flair: Captivating Banner Designs for Seasonal Promotions

content.text: I was responsible for designing the UI/UX and promotional banners for seasonal in-game events.These designs not only highlighted the unique themes of each event but also aimed to captivate players and encourage their participation. The events featured exclusive, time-limited rewards such as skins and avatars, making them highly engaging and motivating for the player base.

items.text: Attract Player Attention: Create visually compelling designs that immediately grab players' interest.
Convey Event Information: Clearly communicate the theme, event name, and rewards at a glance.
Enhance User Engagement: Encourage participation by showcasing the exclusivity of limited-time rewards.
Consistency Across Themes: Balancing creativity for unique themes while maintaining the game’s brand identity
Space Constraints: Ensuring all key information and visuals fit into the limited banner space without feeling cluttered.
Player Motivation: Effectively highlighting rewards to generate excitement and drive engagement.

items: I collaborated closely with the game design team to understand each event's lore, characters, and objectives
I analyzed previous banners to identify design elements that resonated with players and performed well

content.content: For the "Decorated Heroes" event, I wanted to capture the festive spirit of a medieval celebration. I chose a bright castle backdrop complemented by celebratory confetti to set the mood. The characters were designed in regal medieval attire, emphasizing intricate details to reflect the grandeur of the era. Gold and red tones were selected to create a royal and festive atmosphere.

For the "Trick or Treat" event, I aimed to evoke the spooky yet playful essence of Halloween. A deep purple background featuring a glowing full moon and flying bats set the perfect eerie tone. The avatars, including pumpkin-headed characters and witches, brought a whimsical and seasonal touch. Green and orange accents were added to evoke the classic Halloween palette, while the fun, rounded game's font style helped maintain an approachable and playful tone.
Love Is in the Air (Valentine’s Day)

The "Love Is in the Air" event allowed me to explore the romantic themes of Valentine’s Day. I chose pink and red tones as the foundation, framing the visuals with rose motifs to heighten the romantic vibe. The characters were styled with elements like roses, hearts, and elegant outfits to embody the theme. To add a unique twist, I included a humorous goblin character holding a rose.

"Nature’s Dance" was inspired by the renewal and beauty of spring. I used soft pastel colors with floral elements like roses and butterflies to create a cheerful and inviting atmosphere. The characters were dressed in vibrant, spring-themed outfits that complemented the glowing sunburst in the background.

For the "Tropicana" event, I wanted to convey the joy and relaxation of summer. Vibrant colors like turquoise and coral brought the tropical theme to life, while elements like palm trees, sandy beaches, and sunglasses emphasized the season’s carefree vibe.

For the "Winter Festival" event, I focused on creating a festive and cozy holiday atmosphere. Snow-covered trees and a cheerful reindeer character were central to the design. Cool tones of blue and white contrasted with warm festive red to evoke a sense of warmth amidst the winter chill. Sparkling stars and snowflakes added depth to the background, while the bold and cheerful font style enhanced the festive spirit.

With "Astral Alignment," I delved into the futuristic and cosmic theme. A deep blue space palette served as the perfect backdrop for this event, creating a sense of wonder and exploration. Futuristic avatars, including astronauts and cosmic creatures, were designed to resonate with the sci-fi aesthetic. I ensured to incorporate characters and rewards prominently, ensuring they were the focal point of each banner.

items: Increased player participation in seasonal events.
Positive feedback from players, praising the clarity and aesthetic appeal of the banners.
The banners successfully reinforced the game’s brand identity while enhancing the user experience.

items.text: Good Time Management: Helps meet deadlines without compromising quality. Seasonal events often have tight deadlines, requiring efficient planning and execution. Pre-designing reusable templates for recurring events can be highly effective.

Balancing Creativity and Clarity: Ensuring promotional details, such as discounts, deadlines, or event highlights, remain prominent and easy to read. Aesthetic appeal should support, not detract from, the communication goal. Clarity is equally essential.

Emotionally Compelling Designs: Builds a stronger connection with the audience. Seasonal events are emotionally charged, so designs should evoke the right feelings. For example, using warm, nostalgic visuals for the holidays or energizing graphics for New Year's promotions.

workDetails.title: Promotional Design for Google Play
workDetails.subtitle: Crafting Eye-Catching App Store Visuals for Game Promotions

content.content: My objective was to create a series of visually compelling promotional assets for an idle RPG game, specifically optimized for Google Play. The goal was to drive user downloads by highlighting the game’s engaging gameplay mechanics, character diversity, and unique features through attractive and informative visuals.

content.text: As the UI/UX Designer, I was responsible for conceptualizing, designing, and delivering these promotional materials. I ensured that every asset aligned with the game’s branding and adhered to Google Play’s requirements.

content.content: To start, I needed to understand the preferences and expectations of the game's target audience.
Fantasy and RPG enthusiasts, aged 25-45, who are drawn to vibrant graphics and immersive narratives.

items: High-quality visuals that convey the game's depth and excitement.
Emphasis on standout features like character evolution, epic battles, and competitive rankings.
Overwhelming users.
Iteratively refined designs based on feedback from the team and stakeholders.

content.content: I conducted thorough research to guide my designs:
I analyzed top-performing RPG games on Google Play to identify visual trends.

content.text: Key takeaways included the use of vibrant colors, dynamic poses, and clear calls-to-action (CTAs). This analysis helped me ensure that each promotional asset was visually engaging while standing out from the competition.

content.content: I reviewed Google Play’s specifications for resolution, aspect ratio, and layout to guarantee compliance and optimal display across devices.
Showcasing a dynamic in-game battle scene with heroes and enemies in action, this design highlights core gameplay mechanics.

items: I used vibrant visuals and dynamic poses to capture the excitement of battle.
The bright, bold CTA “Win Epic Battles” ensures the message stands out.

content.content: A visually layered asset featuring a grid of diverse characters and a hero in an action pose.

items: I utilized effective layering to add depth to the composition.
Highlighting character variety appeals to players who value customization.
Bold text (“Unlock Heroes”) clearly communicates the feature.
Highlights a grid of diverse characters available in the game, paired with a dynamic action pose in the foreground.

content.content: Displays a leaderboard interface with a character celebrating victory, emphasizing competitive gameplay.

items: Eye-catching character pose conveys triumph.
Clear distinction between “Global” and “Local” rankings, appealing to competitive players.

content.content: Features an illustrated game map with key locations and a hero character in the foreground, emphasizing exploration and story.

items: Vibrant and detailed map design captures the sense of adventure.
Clear CTA (“Save The World”) aligns with the game’s narrative theme.

content.content: Displays a lineup of villainous bosses, emphasizing challenging gameplay.

items: Unique boss designs create visual intrigue.
Darker tones contrast well with other promotional materials, showcasing variety.

content.content: Highlights the evolution mechanic, showing character progression from basic to advanced forms.

items: Clear progression visuals with arrows and glowing effects.
Bright and engaging color palette.
The game saw an increase in downloads within the first month of launch
Players provided positive feedback, praising the visuals for being both appealing and informative.
Stakeholders commended the designs for effectively capturing the game’s core features and excitement. They appreciated how well the visuals aligned with the brand’s vision.

content.content: This project highlighted how combining visually appealing designs with concise, effective messaging can successfully capture and hold user attention.

items: In-depth research and continuous refinement were vital for ensuring my designs met user needs and aligned with industry standards.
Consistency in visual elements across all assets played a key role in building a cohesive and recognizable brand identity.

content.content: Through this experience, I gained valuable insights into crafting visuals that not only resonate with users but also deliver tangible, impactful outcomes.
